issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When using Kerberos for user authentication, the customer noticed that one of their users was getting an error when trying to log in to the console. We see the following message in the eucaconsole.log file for user ccrstaff/minnus.
2015-10-20 14:17:15 INFO http error
{'msg': 'Bad Request', 'fp': None, 'code': 400, 'hdrs': None}
The customer discovered that the user had a ';' in their password. Once they changed the password and removed the semicolon the user was able to log in successfully. The customer pointed out the following two areas in the code which may be causing the problem.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/models/auth.py#L309
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/tokens/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tokens/ws/TokensQueryPipeline.java#L173
It looks like we may be trying to process a ';' as a password change assuming those lines of code are relevant to this problem. I don't have a kerberized environment so I was unable to validate this behavior in the PRC.
fields.summary: Authentication for users fails when password contains a semicolon

comments.body: There is a simple workaround that the customer already used which is to remove the semicolon from the password.
That piece of code in the console uses a semicolon as a separator but the passwords are base64 encoded, so there's no danger of us mistaking the semi in the password.

This is not a GUI or Kerberos or Eucalyptus issue. The problem is that when the login profile is created the password is created with only the chars up to the semi-colon as the OS shell thinks that anything after that is a new command. ( I am using the bash shell ) . I can create the exact same issue trying to create a directory whose name has a semi-colon.
the directory that is created is 'foo" not 'foo;bar" notice the error 'bash: bar: command not found'. This is why we are seeing no errors in the CLC logs as the password that is actually being passed in is in fact being created.
{code}
[mmunn:~]
[mmunn:~]euare-accountcreate -a test
test	000876724696
[mmunn:~]euare-useraddloginprofile --as-account test -u admin -p foo;bar
bash: bar: command not found
{code}

I can then log into the console with the password = foo  while foo;bar will not work.  (see below for example)

{code}
[mmunn:~]mkdir foo;bar
bash: bar: command not found
[mmunn:~]ls -d foo
foo
{code}

Please have the customer try the example above to see if that is in fact what they seeing. I am going to close GUI-2330 as not a bug.

Looking at the supplied link to the server-side code: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/tokens/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tokens/ws/TokensQueryPipeline.java#L173

That line of code looks for a semi-colon. For regular login, the password is unencoded and if it contains a semi-colon, that test will pass and fool the code into thinking we're in a change-password situation. We should add an additional test there to also test for @ if the semi-colon is found. Of course, I see that as kicking the can down the road in case the new password contains a @ character.
In either case, an additional test could be that if the delimiter is found, ensure the field it delimits is base64 decodable. That way, it is much less likely a new password would fool that test.
[~sjones], are you OK converting this to EUCA ticket? Want me to submit a PR for this?
[~dkavanagh] I will convert this to a EUCA ticket.
[~mmunn1], we should check if there is a : or a ; after the username@account part.
[~mmunn1], the attached patch adds a unit test that covers the functionality being fixed.
[~sjones] I am unclear on how to run the test TokensQueryPipelineSpecification.groovy?

[~mmunn1], during development I usually run tests from an IDE. Alternatively you can type "ant junit" either from the clc directory (all tests) or from clc/modules/tokens (tokens module tests) to run tests, though you may need to compile first.

Code Review Request : EUCA-11821 Kerberos authentication for users fails when password contains a semicolon

branch : dev-mmunn1-EUCA-11821

diff :  git show --color 31f163a3820109ec3525fe4e66d10742323240df

Summary: a semi-colon in the password tricks the clc into thinking the password is being changed

Solution: parse the incoming message correctly and allow for ';',':','@'


Unit test : unit tests have been added at /clc/modules/tokens/src/test/java/com/eucalyptus/tokens/ws/TokensQueryPipelineSpecification.groovy
[~mmunn1], the fix looks good to me.
Verified.  I created a user with a login profile password of 'foo;bar' and I also tried password 'foo;b@r'.  I was able to login successfully with both passwords.
